file_content.text: Phew! Been a while since I had a good scrap like that. I'm glad you stopped by.
Your piece of junk is right over there. Hopefully it didn't get shot up too much. Now hand over my credits.
Just as we agreed, Zareen.
Here you go.
Ah, credits, killing... I don't think this day could get any better.
Fine, nutjob.
Whatever pays the bills, my friend.
Watch out for yourself, army girl. Maybe we'll bump into each other again sometime.
Take care of yourself, soldier boy. Maybe I'll see you around.
Mm. I think I'll keep my credits after all.
I changed my mind.
You murdered good men, Zareen. Time to pay for it.
What? Nobody double-crosses me! Get over here!
This is my favorite part!
Die!
My, my, my. I can't for the life of me figure out what you might be after.
I'm Zareen. I take care of... targeted acquisitions, let's say--like that little trinket you came here for. I get the impression that you want it pretty bad.
Surely we can come to a peaceful agreement?
We can work this out.
Peaceful agreements are boring. Unless, of course, they're profitable.
How do you know about the Umbra encrypter?
Why are you involved in this?
Listening in on people's conversations can teach you all sorts of interesting things, my friend.
Hand over that component! Now!
Cooperate or else!
Just because you think you're the biggest killing machine ever to set foot on this frozen rock doesn't make it true.
That piece of junk is worth a lot to you, isn't it? So--make me an offer. If it's high enough, maybe you'll walk out of here.
You want money, you can have it.
You want credits, take some.
Sir! These are the scumbags who killed Yuun's team--we can't just cut a deal with them!
I'm still in charge here, Lieutenant.
No one asked you.
Are you serious? These scumbags killed Republic soldiers, and you actually want to pay them?
I don't think I'll be cutting any deals with you, Zareen.
You're right, Jorgan.
If we can get the parts we need without combat, all the better.
Paying avoids a fight.
Then our fellow soldiers died for nothing. Understood, sir.
I make the decisions, Sergeant. Not you.
No one asked you.
Fine. You're the boss. Sir.
Are you done arguing? Because I think you can make me a better offer.
Hmm. Respectable, but I bet you can do better.
Last chance, army girl. How much is that hunk of scrap really worth?
One more chance, soldier boy. What's that thing really worth to you?
This is all I'm willing to part with, Zareen.
Fine, take more.
It's a deal, army girl. Just hand over the credits.
You've got yourself a deal, soldier boy. Just give me the credits.
I guess we won't be coming to an arrangement after all.
Forget it.
Well, you can't say I didn't try.
You heard my offer. I'm not changing it.
Original offer, or nothing.
Hmm. You drive a hard bargain--I like that. It's a deal.
Now, just hand over the credits, and we'll all part as friends.
I'm through negotiating! Give me the Umbra component!
Shut up and hand it over!
I don't exactly carry a fortune in credits around with me.
I don't have much on me.
Aww. Too bad. Guess I'll just have to have my fun some other way.
I won't cave in to your demands, Zareen.
I'm not scared of you.
Hmm. I should've known there was only one way you'd entertain me.
You can give me what I want, or I can kill you and take it.
Shut up and do what I say.
Got some fight in you, huh? Good.
Nice knowing you, pal.
Halt! I am Major Artano of the Imperial military. Drop your weapons and surrender immediately!
Nobody be too hasty, here. I'm sure we can work this out.
Everyone stay calm!
There is nothing to "work out."
We're right in the middle of a business transaction. Come back later.
Can't talk now, Major.
Quiet, scum! I will deal with you presently.
If you like breathing, drop the guns!
You first!
I was hoping I'd find you here, Captain. You have many noble lives to answer for.
You--the mangy one. You are in possession of stolen Imperial property. Hand it over now, and I will consider sparing your life.
My new friend just made me a nice offer for that item. Unless you can top it, I'll have to pass.
Yeah, yeah. Shut up and make me an offer. If I like it, you can have what you want. If I don't, my boys and I kill everyone here.
The major told me before--he doesn't negotiate.
He won't make an offer.
So, the part goes to you, then.
Imperials take what they want--at gunpoint.
He won't make an offer.
The Imps would rather kill us all than pay out.
You can't trust this man.
Well, Imp? Is my new friend right?
I--I'll double it! Whatever this scum has offered, the Empire will pay twice over.
Well, that is tempting. What do you say? Care to top that offer?
Double, plus extra.
Sure--2500 credits.
I don't have that kind of money.
I can't.
The Imperials will betray you. Take my offer, and I'll help you deal with them.
Stick with me.
That's quite a counter-offer. Think you can top that?
Double it is. Plus a little extra.
Sure--4500 credits.
I can't pay you that much, Zareen.
I can't.
Then we're done here. Boys, take care of this freeloader, would you?
You can't trust Imperials, Zareen. Take my offer--we can handle Artano together.
Stick with me.
Hmm. Why not? Sounds like fun.
Here's my offer!
I'll top it. [Shoot Zareen]
Fine! I'll pay you whatever you want--just give me the part.
Sounds like you're out of luck, friend. So sorry.
This is my final offer, Zareen.
I'll give you 4500 credits.
We have our winner. Sorry, Major.
Treacherous, sub-human scum! Open fire, men! Get that component!
It doesn't have to end like this, Zareen.
We can still work this out.
Boys, could you please deal with this boring chattering noise I keep hearing?
The Imperials will betray you.
You're making a mistake.
You're just jealous. Shut this freeloader up, would you, boys?
Your rabble won't stand a chance alone. Assist them, men--open fire!
I was tired of all this conversation anyway.
Oh, well. [Shoot Zareen]
Ack! Kill her! Gun her down!
Ack! Kill him! Kill him now!
Take cover, men! Return fire!
I'm done negotiating!
Forget that! [Shoot Artano]
Ack! Take cover! Return fire!
Kill 'em all, boys! Kill 'em all!
